dialogues.text: You saw too many bodies? That's a  lot of bodies. (beat; to Price) You stupid son of a bitch. (to Claire) Did he talk you into it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I wanted Rafael to be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In some way I understand him doing  it, I don't like it but I  understand... but you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd do it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex lets it all sink in. These two people about whom he such passionate feelings have totally exposed themselves him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two have, of course, just served  me up your balls -- if that's what  they're called -- on a platter. (several beats) I can bury you both. You're handing  me your careers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't respond -- he's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Jesus Christ... this is a  motherfucking story, Russell... (long silence) What am I supposed to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small, tired gallows laughter from Alex. There is a long  silence before Alex speaks, aware of the irony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're holding the lead in the World  section for Rafael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great stuff, isn't it? We'd go  down in a blaze of glory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah... (distraught) I don't know what to do. (beat) I've gotta take some kind of a story  back with me. Maybe Jazy, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little dangerous looking for  Jazy at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock heroic) Ah, danger -- I love it. You could  ask the pointy-shoed little bastard  about your pictures... and I could  ask him whatever happened to Isela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's an officer in the Rafael army --  we saw her in Matagalpa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is surprised slightly, but takes pleasure in reveali it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean I slept with a Sandinista?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price and Claire exchange glances. Alex is dead serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess Rafael is alive, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRICE AND CLAIRE LIE IN BED sweating. A siren and distant mortar can be heard outside. Price goes to the window and shuts it -- the room is quieter and hotter. He pounds a b air conditioning duct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn air conditioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out the window -- it never used to be this  complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I was home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to him, lies down, and they embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it's almost over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud, long burst of automatic weapons fire is heard  somewhere outside. Their eyes are open as they hold onto  each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sense of foreboding. Heavy road equipment prowls the st looking for Rebel barricades to destroy. Tanquettas and  Guardia everywhere. The flag draped press car of Price and Alex drives slowly P.O.V. OUT OF THE CAR AS THEY LOOK CAREFULLY Things feel  wrong. Guardia barricades are everywhere, forcing them to follow a route they might not choose. The Guardia soldier at the barricades seem on edge. When Jazy's house is visi in the distance, barricades force them another direction. GUARDIA SOLDIERS RACE DOWN A STREET TOWARD GUNFIRE and th car stops. When the road is clear it creeps into an  intersection. They check their position. THE CAR CREEPS TO A STOP and they look around further.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER.
dialogues.text: Everything is wrong. Price looks around restlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex... let's go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazy's probably sitting in the bar  laughing at us. Which way's the hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ask her... be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a sec'... take a flag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Alex is out of the car at once, approaching the woman Alex motions that "it's not necessary" and talks to the w We can't hear, but she points down the block. INSIDE THE CAR Price cranks film into place, his actions automatic and nervous. When he looks up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking in the direction she pointed, he motions to Price if to say, "Just checking this out." PRICE LOOKS AROUND NERVOUSLY FOR A SENSE OF DIRECTION And he does, looks through the camera. THROUGH CAMERA P.O.V. OF THE DEAD PIG followed by quick  blurred pans to other images -- TANK, HOUSE, WOMAN, SOLDI until it settles on ALEX IN THE INTERSECTION. Two Guardia soldiers come up to him and he holds out his hands as if say, "I'm lost." ALEX TALKS TO THE SOLDIERS -- FREEZE FRAME click, click - and the whirring sound of a motor drive, another FREEZE F click, click, more whirring -- Price is on automatic pilo Another soldier orders Alex up against a wall. Nobody sees Price taking pictures -- it happens too quick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLANK RANGE -- FREEZE FRAMES click, click, whirring as th images blur and the camera is dropped.

dialogues.speaker: PRICE STARES WITHOUT THE CAMERA
dialogues.text: P.O.V. ALEX LIES DEAD AS THE SOLDIERS LOOK AROUND The act was random, almost nonchalant. PRICE STARTS TO RUN TOWARD ALEX shouting madly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucks! You fucks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops quickly as they see him, realizing how exposed h is. THE GUARDIA START FIRING AT HIM, realizing the murder was recorded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fotografia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRICE LEAPS IN HIS CAR and starts it up, racing around th corner as bullets rip into the car. THE WINDOW SHATTERS, AND PRICE IS HIT IN THE SHOULDER He  clutches his bleeding arm as he races on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAR GRINDS TO A HALT and Price leaps from it, racing  into a maze of ramshackle huts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hastily called press conference. Tacho takes a quick dr on a cigarette and makes the announcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is with grave concern that we  announce that Alexander Grazier,  senior American correspondent, has  been murdered at the hands of  terrorists...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shock wave goes through the room -- hands raised, quest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kittle has prepared statements  for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somoza turns and leaves as Kittle passes out press statem

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV is on. She's at the typewriter working on a story. A PHOTOGRAPH OF ALEX COMES ON THE TELEVISION NEWS, with  Spanish language commentary over the image.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE KEEPS WORKING AND GRADUALLY TYPES LESS AS SHE HEAR
dialogues.text: the story, finally rising and moving in front of the  television as a local newsman reads of Alex's death and w see the Somoza press announcement. The phone rings: Claire picks up the phone and listens  silently before hanging up. She sits down shakily on the and starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRICE HURRIES THROUGH the passageways between tin shacks, through tiny yards of goats and chickens, through houses poor that the war has nearly passed them by. Price is hur and looks around with fear to see: THE GUARDIA SOLDIERS MOVE DOWN INTO THE SHANTYTOWN, fanni out to quickly engulf the barrio. They move quickly. A HELICOPTER GUNSHIP MOVES IN LOW over the barrio and ope up sporadic outbursts of fire to insure nobody will try t flee. PRICE RUNS DOWN AN ALLEY and nearly runs right into the  Guardia. He hides behind a paper thin wall of flattened b cans -- the Guardia move past him only inches away. Price starts off in another direction, but Guardia appear -- he trapped in the barrio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Journalists are everywhere -- suitcases packed -- trying get out of the country. The registration desk is chaos. R tries to get the attention of the clerk -- so does everyo else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get my bill and get me a cab, hey,  amigo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clerk is under attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No cabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cabs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No cabs!

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE GETS OFF THE ELEVATOR AND MOVES THROUGH THIS CHAOS
dialogues.text: Regis sees her and tries to give her comfort -- she's bey that. She wears a jacket and carries her bag -- she's goi somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Claire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes him away politely; she is single-minded now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard from Russell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanta help me find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regis looks at her like she's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire... it's on the weird side out  there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub Kittle enters the lobby, sees Claire and volunteers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Claire, a human tragedy,  what can I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire is nearly in tears, but resists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off, Hub, get outta my way.

dialogues.speaker: JAZY'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Claire stays in her car and watches the house -- no way t get close -- and she continues driving, her route dictate by the same barricades that directed Alex and Price. She passes the dead pig in the street, and TWO RED CROSS  WORKERS make their way slowly around a corner, frightened Claire gets out of her car and approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Do you know where the American  journalist was killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all point down a street. She shows them the polaroid Price and her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Have you seen him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They haven't and continue on their way. Claire walks in t direction they pointed -- no street fighting but many Gua

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRICE HUNCHES DOWN AND CRAWLS BEHIND THE STALLS as soldie move through the yards looking for him.

dialogues.speaker: THE WOMAN APPEARS IN A DOORWAY AND MOTIONS WITH HER HEAD
dialogues.text: Price to dart inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing is said. Price is led into a room, one of many -- but this room is boarded over. There is no escape. Price in pain, his arm bleeds, he's tiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) This is the best I can offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracias.

dialogues.speaker: PRICE STANDS IN THE TINY ROOM WAITING
dialogues.text: He leans against the wall behind the door. He shuts his e a noise at the door. When he opens them:

dialogues.speaker: THE WOMAN IS STANDING THERE WITH A GUN
dialogues.text: She hands it to him and leaves, bolting the door. PRICE LEANS AGAINST THE WALL HOLDING A REVOLVER and he wa cameras around his neck, gun in hand, bloody, slightly  ridiculous, and scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price's shot up car is not far away, but she's afraid to  approach it. She shows the picture of Price to a small bo who doesn't recognize it. GUARDIA SOLDIER SPOTS CLAIRE and walks toward her. She ca tell if the act is routine or threatening. He calls out t her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venga aqui.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hesitates -- Alex is dead, everything is crazy. She s toward him, then changes her mind, turns, and walks quick away from him.

dialogues.speaker: THE SOLDIER RUNS TOWARD HER
dialogues.text: CLAIRE RUNS FASTER and darts into a narrow passageway beh a house, where she looks back. He calls for support -- se join him and hurry after her. Panicky, she runs between  houses. OVERHEAD PLANES BUZZ THE NEIGHBORHOOD as Claire emerges f the 'maze' to see: P.O.V. PRICE'S CAR ABANDONED and full of holes near the s town. Guardia are everywhere. The helicopter gunship is  overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears the Guard breaking in, and he cocks his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the Squadron Leader and three soldiers burst in -- the woman stands in the middle of the room and lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Nobody is here. Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sqaudron Leader points to different rooms for each  soldier, and they proceed to kick in each door, automatic rifles ready. PRICE'S ROOM AS HE HEARS A SOLDIER AT THIS DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR IS KICKED OPEN, AND A SOLDIER STEPS INTO THE ROO
dialogues.text: For a moment he doesn't see Price -- then he whirls and f the photographer who's so scared he's forgotten to raise gun. PRICE AND THE SOLDIER ARE FACE-TO-FACE The soldier is a  fourteen-year-old boy fighting back tears. He, too, is sc to death. Neither is quite sure why he is there -- they j want it to end. PRICE AND THE BOY AIM THEIR GUNS AT EACH OTHER as they he the voice of the Squadron Leader in the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esta alli?! (Is he there?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esta alli?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SQUADRON LEADER HEADS TOWARD THE ROOM but as he does, the boy soldier appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No esta aqui.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Leader grunts an order, and the squadron quickly head to the next house. PRICE'S BODY SLUMPS AGAINST THE WALL EXHAUSTED, and the w enters as soon as the last soldier has gone. Price's brief moment of peace is shattered by the screami of Guardia troops and the explosions of rocket fire from gunship. He looks outside. THE GUNSHIP FIRES INTO THE SHANTYTOWN killing several of own Guardia troops. A GUARDIA OFFICER screams at the guns and fires a hand gun at the giant chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) We are you! We are you! What are you  doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUARDIA TROOPS EVACUATE THE SHANTYTOWN in a panicky scram to escape their own gunship. PRICE RACES THROUGH THE BACK OF THE SHANTYTOWN, taking  advantage of the chaos, and without slowing down, breaks  free of the maze of the barrio. CLAIRE'S P.O.V. OF PRICE RACING ACROSS THE STREET, past a body and an overturned, smoking car, back into the rubble strewn blocks of the edge of the city. A tanquetta comes  around a corner and sees Price a block away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRICE SEES HER, and races along a wall until they meet,  grabbing her on the run -- each is panicky and frightened and they duck into very shallow cover, barely safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace quickly and tightly, but look around nervous as they do. Price isn't sure if anybody knows about Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guardia did it -- I got pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. A TANQUETTA PASSES ON THE NEXT STREET, visible thr shattered holes in the buildings. A Guardia squadron pass PRICE AND CLAIRE RUN DOWN THE STREET in the opposite  direction, their path guided somewhat by an overturned bu in an intersection, abandoned barricades and roadblocks, the rubble of street fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRICE AND CLAIRE hesitate at the corner and move slowly a seeing two Sandinistas, dressed half in camouflaged gear, half disco. The TWO GUERRILLAS seem to control the street Price and Claire approach warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hola. (the Guerrillas nod;  in Spanish) Do you control this area?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sandinista looks at his comrade, then looks around  nervously, frightened, then shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price and Claire continue on down the street and  simultaneously noticed something strange: THE DOOR TO JAZY'S HOUSE IS WIDE OPEN They approach caref and look in a view to the court-yard. Claire sticks her h in the door slowly, and as she does: A GIANT HAND GUN IS STUCK IN HER TEMPLE as TWO MUCHACHOS  quickly seize her and Price, dragging them inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAZY STANDS WITH A THIRD GUN AT HIS HEAD, being held by t most forceful and crazed of three young Muchachos. With g on Jazy, Price, and Claire, there is much confusion as to who's in charge and what exactly they're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Shut up. We kill them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) No. Only him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guns are aimed back and forth in confusion -- Price a Claire don't have a chance to respond, and they're not su what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Him or him or her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Muchachos begin arguing rapidly among themselves; and they do, Jazy addresses Price and Claire coolly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, here we are, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Assassin! Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys are confused -- they think  I had their family killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You murder people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Murder" is a word for criminals. I  have a job to protect the stability  of a continent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig! Hijo de puta!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is not begging for his life as much as for them to cal down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got caught by some boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Poets too, I imagine. (beat) Is your recorder on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I have a speech to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Muchachos don't understand what he's saying, but they stop to listen to his style. The guns remained trained on all three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you people, but you are  sentimental shits. You fall in love  with the poets, the poets fall in  love with the Marxists, the Marxists  fall in love with themselves. The  country is destroyed with rhetoric,  and in the end we are stuck with  tyrants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazy turns to the boy who jams the gun into his head and  speaks with tired authority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Un minuto, por favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Price and Claire,  more calmly) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) They are journalists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Muchachos are immediately surprised and delighted, an one of them speaks in excited, broken English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Periodistas! Take this picture! I'm  going to blow his head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Muchachos quickly withdraw their guns from Price and  Claire and aim them all at Jazy's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somoza? He is a tyrant too, of course.  A butcher. (beat) But finally that is not the point,  you see. If we wish to survive -- we  have a choice of tyrants, and for  all the right reasons, your poets  choose the wrong side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) Fotografia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (beat) Your picture of Rafael was  brilliant... but I am alive, and  better looking. A good looking  Frenchman with a sympathetic face is  murdered in cold blood while fighting  for the survival of Europe and  America. (beat) You will have another magazine cover! (smiles) Muy complicado, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Ready! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You picked the wrong side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fifty years we will know who's  right. (beat) Are you going to take the picture as  the bullet enters the skull or as it  comes out? This wall's a nice color,  eh? I can move into the sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE TURNS AND WALKS AWAY, her back to the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claire) It's just a story!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRICE REMAINS AND STARES AT JAZY as the Muchachos grow  increasingly impatient. Some part of him wants to take th picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say that if somebody's holding  a gun on you, you should never stop  talking... that's the theory -- who  knows?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRICE TURNS AND WALKS AWAY toward Claire. Still -- Jazy t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's a good thing that I talk  too much...

dialogues.speaker: A GUNSHOT RINGS OUT.
dialogues.text: Price grimaces. Claire shuts her eyes. They turn to look the fallen Jazy as the Three Muchachos, frightened by the own act, race back into the street. For several moments P and Claire stand, frozen, until the rumbling sound of a  helicopter gunship nearby forces them to hurry outside. PRICE AND CLAIRE GO TO THE DOORWAY and look out as a jeep full of Guardia screams past

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TANQUETTA a block away. The neighborhood seems to be chan hands again. Price and Claire slump in the darkness near the doorway; touches near his wounded arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? (he nods) Russell... what did Alex do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. He asked for directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head and leans it against Price's shoulder but the distant popping of guns does not even allow her a moment of mourning. Their heads pop up nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get outta sight -- half the  fucking army's looking for me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not looking for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me have the film... (beat; unsure) ...if I can't get to the hotel I'll  come back here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price doesn't want her to go alone, but he's not that exc about hiding out in the middle of the city either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Christ... (frustrated) I've wrecked everything else, at  least let me take care of you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell... it's more dangerous being  with you than being alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows she's right. He loves her, and he's made enough  disastrous decisions lately. He hesitates, then pops open his camera and removes the film. Price ties the film into the white flag that hangs from a stick stuck into her bel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (affectionately) That's great advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss, and Claire runs out after a Red Cross truck. P watches nervously until they turn a corner, out of sight, then goes back inside Jazy's courtyard. PRICE NEARLY STUM OVER JAZY'S BODY, stops, stares -- he'd forgotten already The body makes him uneasy, and after several moments he f a sheet and covers Jazy. Price then sits down and waits  nervously, sharing the courtyard with Jazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE WALKS ALONGSIDE THE RED CROSS TRUCK as it comes ar a corner. The truck turns one direction, she wants to go other way toward the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: DUSK
dialogues.text: Guardia troops heavily patrol the ground between Claire a the hotel -- a jeep, a troop carrier, a tanquetta, and fi foot soldiers. CLAIRE TAKES TEMPORARY COVER offered by a MIDDLE-AGED WOM who sees that she is afraid of La Guardia. Claire steps b a walled yard. Moments later: A BOY ON A BIKE RIDES SLOWLY OUT OF THE YARD and turns up the hill toward the Guardia and the hotel. Claire's white flag is tied to his handlebars. CLAIRE WATCHES FEARFULLY as the boy pedals into the milit zone. The woman offers Claire some food; she declines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOY PEDALS slowly, in no hurry, past La Guardia troop Some of them watch him curiously, some ignore him. The wh flag flutters as he rides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE RETRACES HER STEPS to the block where Price is hid in Jazy's house. THE TWO DISCO SANDINISTAS LIE DEAD IN THE STREET, a dog s at the bodies. Claire looks around -- there is little sig of life. She enters Jazy's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE ENTERS and stops. She calls out his name, no answe Price is gone. She hurries back outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO GUARDIA TROOP CARRIERS RACE PAST, sirens screaming, l with Guardia soldiers. Claire steps into the street unsur looking every direction. PEOPLE BEGIN COMING OUT OF THEIR HOMES and what remains o their small homes. They come one at a time at first, then small groups, carrying belongings, pets, chickens, etc. CLAIRE SHOWS A PICTURE OF PRICE AND HER to a woman who co out of the house next to Jazy's, but the woman shakes her head, not recognizing Price. A PUSH-PULL PLANE DIVES IN LOW FIRING ROCKETS at the home THE CROWD GROWS and chaotically flees the destruction,  gradually finding a direction out of the city. Claire is  swept along in the crowds, at first without choice, then  finally fleeing for her life with the rest of Managua. As she moves with the crowd, she looks for Price everywhere, without success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL CAMPFIRES burn near the edge of the city where do have taken temporary refuge. Claire arrives to see: A BOD ON A STRETCHER BEING CARRIED up outside stairs to a rooft from which glow several bare bulbs. She goes up the stair to the rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAKESHIFT MOBILE HOSPITAL under awnings and palm fronds capable of moving location in minutes. A WOMAN DOCTOR and two temporary orderlies tend to wounded. A small black an white television sits on a table and those who are able w the seige of Managua on television while it goes on aroun them. Claire looks for Price among the dead or wounded.

dialogues.speaker: THE CITY UNDER ATTACK
dialogues.text: Claire watches for several moments -- smoke, flame, the  buzzing sound of planes swooping low, fleeing crowds. She then notices the television. PRICE'S FOOTAGE OF ALEX'S DEATH comes on the TV screen, a she pushes closer to see the grim sequence. The NEWS  COMMENTATOR explains in Spanish what we see CLAIRE IS SO  DISTURBED AT THE IMAGES that she turns away, sickened, hu guilty, outraged, but unable to break down. She closes he eyes -- her face is covered with tears. The Doctor notice this and speaks softly to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Journalist? (Claire nods) You knew the man who was killed? (she nods again) Fifty thousand Nicaraguans have  died... and now one Yankee. (beat) Perhaps now Americans will be outraged  at what is happening here, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a while for Claire to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... perhaps they will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noise in the distance from mortars. The Doctor speaks cal without bitterness in the voice, but with total convictio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should have killed an  American journalist fifty years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire acknowledges the grim truth of the observation wit slight nod, and walks to the railing as: ALEX'S DEATH IS REPEATED IN FREEZE FRAME SEQUENCE over an over again as the Orderlies, Doctor, and patients gather watch with fascination. CLAIRE STARES OUT AT THE CITY ON FIRE, when her eye catch something -- a light in the sky. She watches:

dialogues.speaker: A HELICOPTER WITH SEARCHLIGHT PASSES OVERHEAD,
dialogues.text: momentarily illuminating the hospital, but it continues o curiously uninterested in the Guerrilla activity. The cho sweeps above a nearby hill and hovers, then slowly lowers earth. CLAIRE WATCHES with interest then descends the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOMOZA WATCHES AS A BACK HOE DIGS UP THE COFFINS of his  parents. An Army helicopter lands, lighting the scene, an Miss Panama rushes from the chopper into his arms as the  turbulence from the blades raises her dress and musses hi hair. Soldiers place the dirt-covered caskets on the roof of Somoza's two Mercedes, hastily tie them down, and the  strange motorcade, flanked by two heavily armed jeeps, dr off into the dark. CLAIRE WATCHES IT ALL from a safe distance, not far from refugee camp. She turns and walks slowly back to the camp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire sits down against the remains of a wall. The war h overtaken her -- she doesn't know if Price is alive -- an though totally involved, she is at last an observer once  again. Claire notices the tiny red light of her recorder still on. She turns it off, and as the sounds of battle  gradually die down, Claire falls asleep -- exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE SLEEPS AGAINST THE WALL as a dog sniffs and licks face. She awakens with a start -- the dog scurries away.  Claire rises and looks around. A LOCAL WOMAN PUSHES A CART carrying the wrapped body of husband through the otherwise quiet streets of Managua. CLAIRE MOVES THROUGH THE CAMP just coming to life, and lo around trying to interpret the eerie silence. A WOMAN ten to her TWO SMALL CHILDREN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Have you seen La Guardia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) No. Is the war over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DISTANT, DRONING NOISE GETS STEADILY LOUDER. Claire loo around nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanquettas! Tanquettas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. -- SEVERAL TANQUETTAS AND EARTH MOVERS coming over the hill in the distance. The Refugees look up fearfully some hide. As the war machinery gets closer, we see that: SANDINISTAS ARE DRIVING THE MACHINES draped with red and  black (F.S.L.N.), blue and white (Nicaraguan), and yellow and white (the Vatican) flags. Graffiti of victory covers the tanquettas. PEOPLE COME INTO THE STREET CHEERING, embracing, only  gradually realizing what has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Is the war over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Es bueno. (It is good.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman continues with her children, her comment  unemotional, and Claire smiles slightly and walks away,  through a city awakening slowly to its victory. CLAIRE STOPS A RED CROSS TRUCK and shows the driver her  picture of Price. The picture means nothing to the driver Claire continues through the city, looking for Price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE WALKS INTO THE POOL AREA where chairs and tables f in the pool, the bar is overturned, and the once sumptuou press oasis is a disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE ENTERS A DESERTED LOBBY, also a mess, and hesitate before climbing the circular stairs. CLAIRE LOOKS INTO PRICE'S ROOM, and finds it empty, and  typically messy.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE WALKS INTO HER OWN ROOM
dialogues.text: looking out at the jubilant city from which smoke still r CLAIRE AND PRICE EMBRACE DEEPLY, holding onto each other  without the slightest intention of letting go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRICE AND CLAIRE COME DOWNSTAIRS to the lobby. They are  cleaned up in fresh clothes; they have survived and the w is over. THE LOBBY IS COMING TO LIFE AGAIN with Regis' camera crew who look like they've had a long night, a BUS BOY, A MAID AN OLD COUPLE, and A WHITE WOMAN, 38, with TWO SMALL DAUG all either sit or mill in the b.g. PRICE AND CLAIRE STOP SHORT at what they see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. -- A HANDMADE CASKET SITTING IN THE LOBBY with the name, "A. Grazier" scrawled in felt pen. Price and Claire stand next to the box silently -- there nothing to say -- but the silence is interrupted by a fam voice that is polite, unforced, and sincere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the best I would do under the  circumstances. The casket, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward silence until they realize that he's sincere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help us ship it home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already taken care of it. (beat) I always liked the guy. I can't even  get tickets for my own family, but I  could get you two on the plane if  you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the woman and little girls as Hub's family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tacho's in Miami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shared silence at the lunacy of the moment, interrupted the tired voice of one of Hub's daughters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Price and Claire) I am sorry. I had a job to do --  that's all -- it put me in some  unhappy situations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub goes over to take care of his family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands of people have gathered to celebrate in loud an joyous singing, led by a group on the highest cathedral s surrounded by Revolutionary leaders waving to the crowds. SINGING GROUP sings a song to Nicaragua, and a song to Ra RAFAEL'S BODY IN A FANCY CASKET is carried in through the crowd to wild cheering and singing. High over the pallbea heads it moves through the crowds. PRICE AND CLAIRE STAND TO THE SIDE watching it all. The  celebration is joyously infectious, and for the moment we can forget the bloodshed, forget the problems that lay ah forget even the death of Alex. PRICE PULLS OUT A CAMERA and begins taking pictures of th celebration. ISELA IS AT THE MICROPHONE with other Guerrilla leaders. CLAIRE WORKS THROUGH THE CROWD with her mike held high,  recording the singing of the crowd. PRICE BACKS UNDER THE AWNING of a stand selling refreshme and especially Rum and Coke mixtures known suddenly and  triumphantly as "Nicalibres." As Price snaps off pictures a voice from an American in casual street clothes drinkin at the temporary bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Pricey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price looks over to see the smiling Oates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all over, eh? We made it. I  like the singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free country. Now it's free, anyway. (raises his drink) Nicalibre!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oates holds up his Kodak Instamatic camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout a quickie? (no response) No? Things are heating up in  Thailand... thought I'd check it  out. (beat) You ain't gonna turn me in, are ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I gonna see ya in Thailand? We  could be friends!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price keeps walking, into the crowd, where he finds Clair Oates orders another Nicalibre, and beats his foot to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a plane to catch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get enough pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer -- a final complicated question from Claire --  they smile. Price waves for a cab which pulls over. They in the cab and drive away.
